Package com.github.yellowstonegames.grid

Class CoordFloatOrderedMap

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.ds.ObjectFloatMap<K>
com.github.tommyettinger.ds.ObjectFloatOrderedMap<Coord>
com.github.yellowstonegames.grid.CoordFloatOrderedMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.github.tommyettinger.ds.Arrangeable, com.github.tommyettinger.ds.Ordered<Coord>, Iterable<com.github.tommyettinger.ds.ObjectFloatMap.Entry<Coord>>
public class CoordFloatOrderedMap extends com.github.tommyettinger.ds.ObjectFloatOrderedMap<Coord>
A variant on jdkgdxds' ObjectFloatOrderedMap class that only uses Coord keys, and can do so more efficiently. This assumes all Coord keys are in the Coord pool; that is, Coord.expandPoolTo(int, int) has been called with the maximum values for Coord x and y. If you cannot be sure that the Coord pool will hold keys placed into here, you should use a normal ObjectFloatOrderedMap instead, since some optimizations here require Coord keys to be in the pool. This does much better if all Coord keys use non-negative x and y values.
A potential use for this class is to sort Coord positions by float values, such as the float[][] maps produced by FOV. Since those have a logical start point for iteration wherever a light source is, and a light source has the highest value, you could fill a CoordFloatOrderedMap with all Coords you wanted to iterate through, associated with their values in the float[][], and call ObjectFloatOrderedMap.sortByValue(FloatComparator) to change the keys' iteration order. There is code for this in fromArray2D(float[][], float, float).

    • with

      public static CoordFloatOrderedMap with(Coord key0, Number value0)
      Constructs a single-entry map given one key and one value. This is mostly useful as an optimization for with(Coord, Number, Object...) when there's no "rest" of the keys or values. Like the more-argument with(), this will convert its Number value to a primitive float, regardless of which Number type was used.
      Parameters:
      key0 - the first and only key; always a Coord
      value0 - the first and only value; will be converted to primitive float
      Returns:
      a new map containing just the entry mapping key0 to value0

    • with

      public static CoordFloatOrderedMap with(Coord key0, Number value0, Object... rest)
      Constructs a map given alternating keys and values. This can be useful in some code-generation scenarios, or when you want to make a map conveniently by-hand and have it populated at the start. You can also use CoordFloatOrderedMap(Coord[], float[]), which takes all keys and then all values. All values must be some type of boxed Number, such as Integer or Double, and will be converted to primitive floats. Any keys that don't have Coord as their type or values that aren't Numbers have that entry skipped.
      Parameters:
      key0 - the first key; always a Coord
      value0 - the first value; will be converted to primitive float
      rest - an array or varargs of alternating Coord, Number, Coord, Number... elements
      Returns:
      a new map containing the given keys and values

    • fromArray2D

      public static CoordFloatOrderedMap fromArray2D(float[][] array, float min, float max)
      Given a 2D float array (which should usually be rectangular), this finds the positions with values between min (inclusive) and max (also inclusive), and places them in a newly-allocated CoordFloatOrderedMap. You may want to sort this by value, using ObjectFloatOrderedMap.sortByValue(FloatComparator), so the highest or lowest float values belong to the first or last items in the order.
      Parameters:
      array - a usually-rectangular 2D float array
      min - the inclusive minimum value
      max - the inclusive maximum value
      Returns:
      a new CoordFloatOrderedMap containing all positions with in-range values, mapped to those values.
